## WorkerDecoderProtocol namespace

Communication protocol with \[\[ITileDecoder\]\].

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare namespace WorkerDecoderProtocol 
```

## Enumerations

|  Enumeration | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [DecoderMessageName](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.decodermessagename.md) | Define possible names of messages exchanged with decoder services within <code>WebWorker</code>. |
|  [Requests](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.requests.md) | Define possible names of requests called on decoder services within <code>WebWorker</code>. |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [isConfigurationMessage(message)](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.isconfigurationmessage.md) | Type guard to check if an object is an instance of <code>ConfigurationMessage</code>. |
|  [isDecodeTileRequest(message)](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.isdecodetilerequest.md) | Type guard to check if an object is a decoded tile object sent to a worker. |
|  [isTileInfoRequest(message)](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.istileinforequest.md) | Type guard to check if an object is an info tile object sent to a worker. |

## Interfaces

|  Interface | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [ConfigurationMessage](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.configurationmessage.md) | Interface for a ConfigurationMessage that is sent from the datasource to the decoder. The message used to configure the \[\[ITileDecoder\]\]. |
|  [DecoderMessage](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.decodermessage.md) | Interface for <code>DecodedTileMessage</code> which describes metadata for a decoded tile. |
|  [DecodeTileRequest](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.decodetilerequest.md) | This object is sent to the decoder asking to decode a specific tile. The expected response type is a \[\[DecodedTile\]\]. |
|  [TileInfoRequest](./harp-datasource-protocol.workerdecoderprotocol.tileinforequest.md) | This object is sent to the decoder asking for a tile info of a specific tile. The expected response type is a \[\[DecodedTile\]\]. |
